meanings.definition: Extend out or project as a jut or overhang.
meanings.sent1: The tree juttied out over the fence, providing shade.
meanings.sent2: The balcony juttied from the side of the house, offering a great view.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to juttied its paw out to reach the toy but couldn't quite make it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination juttied her above the obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The cliff juttied into the sea, creating a stunning natural formation.

meanings.definition: To build out or extend a part of a building.
meanings.sent1: The architect juttied the new wing of the museum to accommodate more exhibits.
meanings.sent2: They juttied the roof to create a covered entrance for the building.
meanings.sent3: The builders accidentally juttied the wall too far, causing a design flaw.
meanings.sent4: The construction crew juttied the structure skyward, impressing all who saw it.
meanings.sent5: The addition juttied seamlessly with the original building, blending old and new.
